alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Sherman; Wallace (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 04 at 7:24PM CDT until September 04 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Extended... .Red Flag Warning has been extended due to the incoming wind shift to the NW and winds gusting 45 to 55 mph, some blowing dust may accompany these winds. There is also potential for dry lightning to accompany any developing storms along and north of Interstate 70 which may spark a fire. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR WIND, RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND LIGHTNING FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001, 013, 027, 253, AND 254... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 001 Cheyenne, 013 Sherman, 027 Wallace, 253 Kit Carson and 254 Cheyenne. * TIMING...Through 8 PM MDT today. * WINDS...Southwest 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph becoming NW 20 to 25 mph gusting 45 to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * LIGHTNING...a few thunderstorms with dry lightning potential are possible along and north of Interstate 70. * IMPACTS...Any fires that occur may quickly become out of control. A cold front will move through the Red Flag Warning area causing winds to shift to the north and northwest with gusts up to 55 mph. Lightning from thunderstorms may lead spark fires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and lightning can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
